description.narrative: To build, strengthen, and maintain Community Development Councils (CDCs) as effective institutions for local governance and social-economic development.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Section I. A. 4 | Description :MRRD shall maintain an inter-ministerial committee throughout projectimplementation | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Section I. A.2 | Description :MRRD shall maintain a Program Management Office throughout project implementation.| Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section I. A.3 and Section I. B. 4 | Description :MRRD through the PMO shall retain a qualified FinancialManagement Agent to assist MRD in compliance with all FM requirements in the FA | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Section I. A.9 | Description :The Recipient shall carry out the project in accordance with the OperationsManual, FM manual, the procurement manual, the ESMF, and the GAAP | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Section I. B. 2 | Description :The Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association interim unauditedquarterly financial reports for the project | Frequency :Quarterly

title.narrative: Min. of 70% of sampled infrastructure subprojects are functional and used by communities one year after completion (First block grant communities)

actual.value: 93% (7,208) of 7,710 infrastructure completed sub projects are functional and used by communities. Source: Post ImplementationMonitoring Report 22 June - 31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: 70% of sampled communities satisfied with FP performance

actual.value: 96% (6,913) of CDCs are satisfied with performance of their FPs. Source: Monitoring reports during implementation 22 June-31 Dec2016.

title.narrative: Min. of 80% of new CDCs complete their CDPs according to NSP principles and operational guidelines (First block grant communities)

actual.value: 99.6% (12,250) out of (12,287) new CDCs completed their CDPs. Source: MIS report 22 June- 31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: Number of CDC members (male and female) trained

actual.value: As a result of mentioned training hours, in total 336,905 (212,202 male and 124,748 female) CDC members are trained. Source: CDDreport 22 June - 31 Dec 2016.In total 3,857 FPs' staff (3,098 male and 759 female) are trained on NSP training packages. Source:CDD report 22 June - 31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: Min. of 60% of eligible CDCs have Community Participatory Monitoring (CPM) teams functioning

actual.value: In total 22,288 CPM teams established (13,016 CPM teams in NSP IIIA and 9,272 in NSP IIIB), out of which 89% (19,923) of them arefunctioning and monitor their sub projects. Source: CPM reports 22 June- 31 Dec 2016. Out of total number of CDC members(192,525) in NSP IIIB communities, 45% (86, 404) of them are female. Source: MIS Report 22 June - 31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: Number of NSP’s staff trained (male and female)

actual.value: In total 5,268 NSP staff (4,826 male and 442 female) trained. Source: CDD report 22 June- 31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: 50% of CDCs solved the confilicts raised at their own communities

actual.value: In total of 4,679 CDCs 4,938 Conflicts were raised out of which 3,580 (73%) are solved by CDCs. Source: Monitoring reports duringimplementation 22 June-31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: Minimum of 60% of CDCs perform their functional mandates in the areas of community development and coordination, project implementation and conflict resolution

actual.value: Out of 4,733 monitored CDCs, 80% (3,802) CDCs performed their functional mandates such as conducting CDC meetings, sharing ofinformation, linkages, successful completion of sub projects (Post Implementation Monitoring reports) source: Post ImplementationMonitoring Reports 22 June-31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: At least one subproject completed by 70% of eligible CDCs (Repeater block grant communities)

actual.value: Out of total 11,409 CDCs financed, 99% (11,343) of these CDCs successfully completed at least one sub project. Source: MIS report22 June- 31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: At least one subproject completed by 80% of CDCs (First block grant communities)

actual.value: Out of total 11,760 CDCs financed, 98% (11,557) of these CDCs successfully completed at least one sub project. Source: MIS report22 June- 31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: Community contribution in the total project costs (percentage)
Area provided with irrigation and drainage services - Improved (ha)
Number of additional classrooms built or rehabilitated at the primary level resulting from project interventions.
Area provided with irrigation and drainage services - New (ha)
Area provided with irrigation and drainage services (ha)
Improved community water points constructed or rehabilitated under the project
Number of people in rural areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project
Minimum of 70% of sampled women representatives in the CDCs take active part in decision making related to community development
Improved latrines constructed under the project
At least 50% of total beneficiaries are female

actual.value: 48% (13,764,525) of NSP III total beneficiaries (28,693,199) are female for both NR and RBG communities. Source: MIS database.

title.narrative: 35% of CDC members nationally are women

actual.value: Out of the total number of CDC members (158,228) in NSP IIIA (first block grant) Communities, 32% (51,082) of them are female. (MISReport).Out of total number of CDC members (192,525) in NSPIIIB (repeater block grant) communities, 45% (86,404) are female.Source: MIS Report 22 June-31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: 90% of FP invoices paid in accordance with contractual timetable

actual.value: 76% of FP invoices are paid in accordance with contractual timetable. Source: FPMD.

title.narrative: Min. of 75% of sampled infrastructure subprojects are functional and used by communities one year after completion

baseline.value: For NSP I & II 85% of sampled sub-projects were functional and used.

actual.value: Out of the total 7,331 Sub-Projects monitored 80% (5,900) Sub-Projects are functional and used by the communities. Source: PostImplementation Monitoring Report 22 June- 31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: One annual NSP progress report produced

actual.value: One annual report to be generated by the closure of project (End March 2017).

title.narrative: Minimum of 30% of sampled CDCs attempt to form linkages with government and non-government actors.

baseline.value: No information reported on this baseline indicator yet.

actual.value: 71% (2,622) CDCs formed linkages with government authorities as well as 59% (2,387) of CDCs formed linkages with I/NGOs and otherdevelopment actors. Source: Post Implementation Monitoring Reports 22 June-31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: Minimum of 70% of sampled communities have improved access to services.

baseline.value: Of the existing 17,400 CDCs, approx. 34,800 subprojects have been completed.For new CDCs the baseline is 0.

actual.value: 80% (6,107) of the sampled communities have access to services (irrigation, power, transport, water supply and other facilities)and used by the targeted beneficiaries. Source: Post Implementation Monitoring Reports 22 June-31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: Min. of 70% of sampled CDCs conduct social audit meetings

baseline.value: Social audit meetings were added as an enhanced feature of NSP III, therefore baseline value is 0

actual.value: Out of 13,817 communities monitored, 20% (2,822) of the communities conducted social audit meetings. Source: Monitoring ReportsDuring Implementation 22 June-31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: 80% of complaints processed by NSP using agreed service standards

baseline.value: System was not developed at time of baseline data collection

actual.value: Out of 2,273 grievances received, 2,009 (88%) have been solved. Source: Grievance Handling Database 22 June- 31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: 90% of CDCs have been trained on core and second phase training topics

baseline.value: Under NSP I&II, 22,000 CDCs were trained in core topics. For new and 2nd phase training the baseline is 0

actual.value: 99% (26,282) of elected CDCs trained as per NSP OM and training packages by FPs. (FPs’ report out of 26,372 CDCs established)and3,511,290 hours (438,910) client days) of training provided to CDC members. Source: CDD Report 22 June-31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: Of the eligible CDCs, min. of 70% of CDPs revised and completed according to NSP principles and operation guidelines (Repeater block grant communities)

actual.value: Out of 11,505 CDCs re-elected 99.9% (11,498) of CDCs revised and completed their CDPs according to NSP operation guidelines.Source: MIS report 22 June- 31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: Minimum of 80% of CDCs have new elections for leadership through democratic elections and secret ballot at the appropriate time.

actual.value: Out of the total (15,904) mobilized communities, the CDC election was conducted in 96% (15,277) according to NSP mandatedprocedures. Source: Monitoring reports during implementation 22 June-31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: Min. of 70% of sampled communities recognize CDCs as the legitimate institution and representative of communities

actual.value: 96% (14,251) of sampled communities, recognize their CDCs as the representative in decision making and development of theircommunities, Out of total (3,605,678) number of eligible voters, 71% (2,575,155 ) voted for their representatives in CDC election.Source: Monitoring Database 22 June-31 Dec 2016.

title.narrative: Number of CDCs received maintenance cash grants
